name: roastbeet
text: Ah, to be a toy otter...

name: grog
text: They really sugar coat the part about the stingrays on that tour.

name: unquotable
text: Ah to be in school and go on field trips to that place every year... man I miss that.

name: songbirdspectre
text: no one understands how much me and philippe have in common.

name: overmedicated
text: No-one understands you.

name: songbirdspectre
text: A comment left by songbirdspectre was marked as spam and excluded. songbirdspectre: What a douche. (reported by Magb, Rapid_Roy, mrn)

name: wino
text: A comment left by wino was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, saturnbeads, mystkmanat, I_Love_Kate)

name: notself
text: I tried to go there but it was too expensive.

name: hotmethodist
text: I touched a manta ray there. it was awesome in only a way that listening to a self-guided tour could make me remember.

name: mr_pete
text: Narrator: Richard Kiley

name: goocifer
text: We've spared no expense.

name: ambala
text: This is the kinda stuff my kid brother does.

name: billyamericana
text: Too bad it's the Super-Muffled French edition.

name: cashprizes
text: i like to think right at that moment the tape tells him to continue on upstairs.

name: mortshire
text: that philippe's an awesome kid. the ideal.

name: jokercross
text: In fairness, it's a really good tour.

name: a_dude
text: he is only 5.

name: idsyen
text: At this point I think he's still intended to be retarded, which changes the tone of the humor in this strip pretty drastically.

name: daedala_x
text: Philippe was never intended to be retarded! Granted, all 5 year olds are kind of retarded, though it might actually be better if they were fully retarded because at least retards don't cry or have sense enough to ask you for stuff.

name: idsyen
text: I have to disagree. If you look at the original description, it describes him as a retarded otter, and I think you can tell that's what Onstad had in mind for the first run of strips. It's never explicit, but the most obvious one is when it's gross when he opens his mouth. After a handful of strips the characterization shifts and he seems much more like a little kid. I think Onstad changed his mind about what he wanted to do with the character.

name: em2
text: I think you have a good point here. The truly funny/sad thing is that if you Google "Achewood," the site's description is still "A cartoon of modern life as lived by a retarded otter, an alcoholic tiger, and two bears."

name: neitherman
text: Philippe just wanted to extend Shark Week.

name: jeannetteandre
text: I don't blame him.  It's worth it.

name: max
text: That Aquarium is my favorite aquarium. I admire the little dude's taste.

name: direhaggis
text: A comment left by direhaggis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by MrMojoRisin, NDCaesar, Eikre)

name: smallgods
text: Yes...Hence, the irony.

name: featurelessvoid
text: Better still, it's a tour of a place where he would be an exhibit.

name: beefsmipeep
text:
Maybe he likes to listen to the part about the otters - would that be so wrong?

He's obviously in a state of (perpetual?) bliss

name: spectre
text: The shrooms are still working.

name: envika
text: Poor deprived Philippe...

name: bhlaab
text: it looks like philippe has too many arms

name: gormster
text: He's an otter.

name: sankster
text: That would be because of the wire connecting the headphones to the tape player.

name: bhlaab
text: yes i know but it still looks like he has too many!

name: howl
text: I know, right?

name: zapatos
text: It looks like he is dancing... likely to a monotone voice.

name: clever-nickname
text: man, I haven't been to the Monterey Bay Aquarium in years.

name: nerdjcrudbird
text: this is highly underrated

name: juanclaudius
text: Is it sad that I'd kill to have that tape?

name: mindbnder
text: The only thing better than listening to tapes like this by yourself is listening to them when you are sitting in the mall.  The descriptions tend to match up perfectly.

name: wonelove
text: I am so doing this one day

name: tibia
text: I have done this.  Several times.

name: ferryboy
text: Whats's awesome is that the otters are my favorite part of that whole damn place. awesome.

name: red-barchetta
text: I just noticed that the bears ears are back to the older style. Perhaps it was awhile before Chris stabilized his drawing technique?

name: fearless_tulips
text: Dude...I effing love him. One day, I will abduct him, and he will not even know to be scared. And he will be MINE!!!

name: sparhawk
text: You just know those aren't real headphones either: http://achewood.com/index.php?date=05032006

name: wonglers
text: Is it safe for an otter to visit an aquarium?

name: rowen
text: Now is he pretending he actually sees the animals discribed? Or when it comes to the part about "if you look to your left, you can see the penguins at play" does he eagerly turn to the wall, only to be brutally disappointed?

name: theguitarhero
text:
I'm surprised that, with so many Achewood-loving musicians out there, this hasn't become an album name.

This does NOT give you free license to do so. I call dibs.

name: howl
text: No. No. I had this idea. I had it, completely independent of you and I reserve the right to use it as long as it hasn't been taken already.

name: theguitarhero
text:
but I called dibs 1 months ago!

We can coexist with this idea, this is OK.

name: theguitarhero
text: I am OK with this.

name: howl
text:
Yes. That is alright. That is cool.

Btw I hit chubby when I meant reply. Oh well, enjoy your chubby.

name: theguitarhero
text: Dammit I thought someone thought what I said was funny.

name: maldraedior
text: It always takes a moment to realize Phillipe does not have two arms on one side

name: srikamaraja
text: ...I would listen to that tape. All the way through. In much the same manner, save for my external ears.

name: atticusonline
text: Philippe is staring at me.

name: fattypneumonia
text: And when you stare at a 5-year old otter, the 5-year old otter also stares back into you.
